The beanshell fix worked. I got one alert:

i.


Time:   	 Sep. 20, 2009 21:58:41 GMT
Level:  	SEVERE
Message:

Fatal exception in ToeThread #19:
http://newyork.craigslist.org/mnh/tix/1371733715.html (in thread
'ToeThread #19: http://newyork.craigslist.org/mnh/tix/1371733715.html'; in
processor 'Preprocessor')

Exception:

java.lang.NullPointerException
Stacktrace: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbMultipleWorkQueues.delete(BdbMultipleWorkQueues.java:438)
	at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbWorkQueue.deleteItem(BdbWorkQueue.java:91)
	at org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueue.dequeue(WorkQueue.java:166)
	at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.finished(WorkQueueFrontier.java:879)
	at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:157)

>
> >
>
> igor@... wrote:
>> 3) dumpExtraStats().
>> Here are three consecutive dumps.
>>
>> 2009-09-17 18:33:21.822 INFO thread-97
>> org.archive.util.CachedBdbMap.dumpExtraStats() DB name:servers,  Cache
>> Hit: 99%, Not in map: 79937, Total number of gets: 14330000
>> 1=NullPhantom
>>  6=TransientCond  901870921=AwaitExpunge  0=NullValue  0=NotInMap
>> 0=AwaitTimeout  422830=SwapIn  85379=diskHit  14164684=cacheHit
>> 14330000=countOfGets  0=SwapInRetry  887040=DiskPut  0=Remove1Used
>> 0=Remove2Used  0=ReplaceUsed  0=PutUsed  75196=PutIfUsed  0=SyncUsed
>> 79887=diskMapSize  452=memMap.size
>
>
>> 2009-09-17 18:37:07.468 INFO thread-60
>> org.archive.util.CachedBdbMap.dumpExtraStats() DB name:servers,  Cache
>> Hit: 99%, Not in map: 79986, Total number of gets: 14340000
>> 1=NullPhantom
>>  6=TransientCond  1101700501=AwaitExpunge  0=NullVal
>> ue  0=NotInMap  0=AwaitTimeout  423101=SwapIn  85433=diskHit
>> 14174581=cacheHit  14340000=countOfGets  0=SwapInRetry  888044=DiskPut
>> 0=Remove1Used  0=Remove2Used  0=ReplaceUsed  0=PutUsed  75245=PutIfUsed
>> 0=SyncUsed  79936=diskMapSize
>>  377=memMap.size
>
> These helpfully disprove my earlier theory: the 0 NotInMap value means
> the branch I thought might be taken isn't.
>
> The 1 NullPhantom and 6 TransientCond numbers are possibly interesting;
> I'm looking if they could be signs of what went wrong, and whether this
> code can be refactored to be less complicated.
>
> Let me know if you ever get to take a chance on the beanshell-fixup
> approach, and if it works. (I still think it might allow all the loops
> to exit.)
>
> - Gordon
